titleStmt.title: Henry M. Parker to James W. Tate
CWG7917

availability.p: This image and transcription is publicly accessible. The image appears courtesy of the repository named in the Source Description. The transcription and annotation were undertaken by Kentucky Historical Society staff, volunteers, and interns. If referencing this document title, accession number, and permanent URL.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition
Early Access

msIdentifier.repository: Kentucky Department for Libraries and Archives
msIdentifier.collection: Office of the Governor, James F. Robinson: Appointments by the Governor, Civil Appointments, 1862-1863

body.p:
Office of H. M. & H. G. Parker,
Counsellors at Law,
46 Washington Street
Henry M. Parker.
Horatio G. Parker.
Boston March 20th 1863.
James W. Tate Esqr
Assistant Secy of State.
Frankfort Kentucky --
Dear Sir.
I have the honor to inclose the evidence of my having qualified under my commissioner from the State of Kentucky and to enclose an impression of my official seal.

Yrs respy --
Henry M. Parker
Commissioner.
